definition: reign name of Qing emperor (1821-1850)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
Daoguang Emperor

sentences.english: The sun was coming out of the horizon. First it was just a ray of light.
sentences.chinese: 太阳已经升出地平线了，首先是一道光。

sentences.english: Is unhappy, is also not warm, may also move that Daoguang.
sentences.chinese: 不欢乐，也不热烈，也可以触碰那道光。

sentences.english: Wei Yuan was a very well-known mountains-and-waters poet since Qing Daoguang.
sentences.chinese: 魏源是清道光以来著名的山水诗人。

sentences.english: And when the shadow fades and is no more, the light that lingers becomes a shadow to another light.
sentences.chinese: 当阴影消逝，驻留的光将成为另一道光的阴影。

sentences.english: Ron 'Sparkplug' Witwicky: What was that light we just saw?
sentences.chinese: 我们刚刚看到的那道光是什么东西？

sentences.english: The second jet of light hit him squarely on the chest.
sentences.chinese: 另一道光正好击中他的前胸。

sentences.english: Prince Gong, Yixin, was the sixth son of Emperor Daoguan.
sentences.chinese: 恭亲王奕★是道光皇帝的第六个儿子。

sentences.english: The zodiacal glow refers to the diffuse scattered sunlight on the ecliptic plane .
sentences.chinese: 黄道光指的是在黄道平面上漫散射的太阳光。

sentences.english: When you see the zodiacal light, you are looking edgewise into our own solar system.
sentences.chinese: 当你看到黄道光时，你看到的是我们太阳系的边缘。

sentences.english: The converged commercial firms daring Daoguang years were estimated to eight or nine hundreds, or even to one thousand.
sentences.chinese: 道光年间汇聚周村的商人商号可达八九百家乃至千家。

sentences.english: After several long seconds, the light returned to her body violently and her chest jumped.
sentences.chinese: 过了漫长的几秒钟，那道光猛然射回了她的体内。

sentences.english: A light suddenly flashed around her, then a soft smoke.
sentences.chinese: 一道光突然在她周围亮了起来，然后是一股烟雾。

definition: Jiaqing Emperor (1760-1820), seventh Qing emperor, personal name 顒琰|颙琰[Yong2 yan3], reigned 1796-1820
reign name of Qing emperor (1850-1861)/Xianfeng county in Enshi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 恩施土家族苗族自治州[En1 shi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Hubei
reign name of Qing emperor (1861-1875)
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
Daoguang Emperor
Hongzhi Emperor, reign name of ninth Ming emperor 朱祐樘[Zhu1 You4 tang2] (1470-1505), reigned 1487-1505, Temple name 明孝宗[Ming2 Xiao4 zong1]
Qianlong Emperor (1711-1799), sixth Qing emperor, princely title 寶親王|宝亲王[Bao3 Qin1 wang2], personal name 弘曆|弘历[Hong2 li4], reigned 1735-1799
Kangxi, title of the reign (1661-1722) of the Kangxi Emperor 聖祖|圣祖[Sheng4 zu3]
Hongxi Emperor, reign name of fourth Ming emperor Zhu Gaochi 朱高熾|朱高炽[Zhu1 Gao1 chi4] (1378-1425), reigned (1424-1425), Temple name 明仁宗[Ming2 Ren2 zong1]
(Ming and Qing dynasties) daotai (title for an official responsible for supervising a circuit 道|道[dao4]), aka taotai and circuit intendant
Yongzheng, reign name of Qing emperor (1722-1735)
five (main) colors (white, black, red, yellow, and blue)/multicolored
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]
